title: China, Japan Our Competitors, Not Andhra: Revanth Reddy Unveils Vision 2047
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy made a powerful declaration today, announcing that the state is setting its economic benchmark not against its neighbouring states, but against Asian economic powerhouses.

title: Verdict Must Not Be "Tossed Out" With Change Of Judge: Top Court Judge
content: Verdicts should not be "tossed out" merely because the judges who authored them have changed or demitted office, Supreme Court judge Justice BV Nagarathna said.

title: Sheikh Hasina Ordered 2009 Bangladesh Mass Killings: Commission
content: A commission set up to investigate a violent mutiny that saw dozens of senior army officers massacred 16 years ago on Sunday said former premier Sheikh Hasina had ordered the killings.

title: Swiss Right-To-Die Group Claims Founder Died By Assisted Suicide
content: The head of Swiss right-to-die organisation Dignitas has died through assisted suicide, the group said in a statement on Sunday.

title: Ticket Checker Charged For Pushing Navy Officer's Wife To Death In UP Train
content: A ticket examiner was booked for allegedly pushing the wife of a Navy officer to her death from a Patna-Anand Vihar special train near Etawah in Uttar Pradesh, officials said on Friday.

title: India's Population To Stabilise By 2080 Due To Dip In Fertility Rate: Report
content: India's population is expected to stabilise by 2080 at 1.8 or 1.9 billion due to dipping total fertility rate, which is currently below the replacement level at 1.9, an official said.

title: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor Skips Crucial Party Meeting Again
content: Congress Working Committee Member and MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday missed an important meeting of the Congress's strategic group, led by Sonia Gandhi, regarding the winter session of Parliament.

title: Pak-Occupied Kashmir Part Of India So No GST On Trade, Rules High Court
content: The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has ruled that trade between Jammu and Kashmir and the Pakistan Occupied Kashmir or PoK across the Line of Control is intra-state trade and therefore, no GST can levied on it.

title: Afghan Man Behind National Guard Attack Struggled With Isolation For Years
content: The Afghan man accused of shooting two National Guard members blocks from the White House had been unravelling for years, unable to hold a job and flipping between long, lightless stretches of isolation.

title: Afghan Who Shot National Guard Members Radicalised In US: Homeland Security
content: US authorities believe the Afghan immigrant accused of ambushing National Guard members in Washington, DC, was not radicalised until after he came to the United States, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said on Sunday.

title: Manipur's Displaced People Intensify Protest To Demand Safe Passage Home
content: A sit-in protest in Manipur's capital Imphal by hundreds of people living in relief camps escalated into a massive rally today as the internally displaced persons (IDPs) demanded a safe passage home.

title: Delhi Police Bust Pak-Backed Terror Module, 3 Arrested
content: The Special Cell of Delhi Police has busted a Pakistan-backed terror module led by gangster-turned-terrorist Shahzad Bhatti, currently based in the neighbouring country, an official said on Sunday.

title: UP Man Goes To 'Tantrik' To Win Ex-Lover Back, Gets Killed During Ritual
content: Police on Sunday arrested a self-styled 'tantrik' for allegedly murdering a 26-year-old man near a mazar in Shivli after a dispute over "vashikaran" rituals, officials said.

title: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister's Son Gets Married In Mass Ceremony In Ujjain
content: Governor Mangubhai Patel on Sunday praised Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav for setting "a fine example of social harmony" by getting his younger son married at a mass ceremony in Ujjain.

title: Indian Student, 30, Killed In UK Stabbing
content: A 30-year-old man, identified locally as an Indian student, was stabbed during a street attack in central England and later died of the serious injuries in hospital.

title: 80 Killed In Police Encounters, Custody Since 2021, Assam Assembly Told
content: 39 of them died in police custody, while 41 died in custody before they were produced before the court.

title: Rare Pygmy Killer Whale Found Dead On Odisha Coast
content: A rare pygmy killer whale was found dead on the coast of Odisha's Bhadrak district, officials said on Sunday.

title: 11 Killed, 60 Injured After 2 Passenger Buses Collide In Tamil Nadu
content: At least 11 people were killed and 60 others injured after two Tamil Nadu government buses collided head-on near Kummangudi in Sivaganga district on Sunday evening, police said.

title: "Working Will Be Optional In Next 20 Years": Elon Musk's Big Prediction
content: Elon Musk has predicted that people "won't have to work at all" in the future. And, artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics would bring about that change, said the tech billionaire.

title: Company, Domain, Son: Elon Musk Explains 'Fixation' With Letter 'X'
content: Appearing on the latest episode of Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's "WTF is?" podcast, Elon Musk said that when he initially acquired the domain name 'X' in 1999, his idea was to "solve" money from an information theory standpoint.

title: Kiffin takes LSU job, won't finish year with Rebels
content: Lane Kiffin is the new coach at LSU, and he will not continue with Ole Miss on its College Football Playoff run as the Rebels promoted Pete Golding to head coach.

title: Dawgs, Ducks, Tech climb in poll; A&M drops to 7
content: Texas A&M fell out of the top five of The Associated Press college football poll for the first time in two months Sunday, while Texas Tech notched its highest ranking in 17 years.

title: Colts CB Gardner suffers noncontact calf injury
content: Colts cornerback Sauce Gardner sustained a left calf injury early in Sunday's game against the Texans and has been ruled out for the remainder of the day.

title: Gators hire Sumrall as HC, to add Caldwell as GM
content: Florida has hired Tulane's Jon Sumrall as its next football coach, with sources telling ESPN that the six-year deal is for an average of nearly $7.5M per season.

title: Auburn hires South Florida's Golesh as new coach
content: Auburn has hired South Florida's Alex Golesh as its new coach. Golesh, who went 23-15 over three seasons at USF, will get a six-year deal, sources told ESPN.

title: Pearsall after shooting: I want to live 'happy life'
content: 49ers receiver Ricky Pearsall said he was unsure of his fate after he was shot in the chest during an armed robbery last year.

title: Sources: Warriors have space to sign Seth Curry
content: The Golden State Warriors will sign veteran guard Seth Curry to a contract for the remainder of the season Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Belichick's debut UNC season ends in rivalry loss
content: Bill Belichick's debut season at North Carolina ended with a blowout loss to rival NC State, capping a 4-8 campaign filled with struggles for the Tar Heels.

title: Predicting every postseason matchup as regular season ends
content: With bowl season fast approaching, we forecast who will play where, including the College Football Playoff.

title: Week 13 inactives: Bills wait on Dalton Kincaid, J.J. McCarthy sits
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Awful in first half, magic in second: Joshua Zirkzee leads Man United comeback
content: Man United and Joshua Zirkzee had a poor first half vs. Crystal Palace, but one moment of magic turned everything around.

title: Liverpool needed Isak, Wirtz to ease pressure on Slot, and they did
content: A fine performance from Florian Wirtz and a first goal for Alexander Isak eased some pressure on Liverpool.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 14, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What happens if there's no deal at the end of the 30 days?
content: How far apart are the two sides and what if a deal isn't in place by the Sunday WNBA deadline for a new CBA?

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to move for Real Madrid's Valverde
content: Manchester United are exploring a move for Real Madrid midfielder Federico Valverde. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Two Gujaratis charged in $653,000 US gold bar scam
content: Two Gujarati men based in Chicago suburbs face felony charges for allegedly defrauding an elderly woman in North Kenosha of over $653,000 in gold. Prosecutors state this is part of an international scam where the victim was tricked into believing her savings were compromised. The accused are charged with money laundering and theft, with evidence suggesting overseas coordination.

title: IND vs SA: Kohli's hundred, Kuldeep four-for power India’s 17-run win in first ODI
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 52nd ODI century powered India to a 17-run victory over South Africa in the first ODI. Kuldeep Yadav's crucial wickets and Harshit Rana's early burst secured India's 1-0 series lead. Kohli's stellar 135 set up a formidable 349, with Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul also contributing significantly.

title: ‘Pakistan module busted’: Three held in Delhi; plot to target Anmol Bishnoi uncovered
content: Delhi Police busted a terror-gangster module run by Pakistan-based Shehzad Bhatti, allegedly planning to target Lawrence Bishnoi's brother. Three youths, Asif, Hargunpreet Singh, and Vikas Prajapati, were arrested for executing grenade attacks in Punjab. Bhatti lured them with money and remotely coordinated operations, using social media to recruit disposable foot soldiers for public place attacks.

title: NC puts spotlight back on special status, counters ‘pro-BJP’ talk
content: The National Conference (NC) has reaffirmed its commitment to restoring Jammu and Kashmir's special status under Article 370 through a recent working committee resolution. This move aims to counter claims of the party abandoning a core issue and aligning with the BJP. NC also urged the Centre to restore full statehood to J&K as promised.

title: Noor Inayat Khan: How this Indian-origin spy gave the Nazis a tough time
content: Codenamed ‘Madeleine,’ she was known in French Resistance circles as a mysterious figure who seemed to appear and vanish like smoke. France recently honoured her with a commemorative postage stamp for her crucial role in the fight against the Nazi regime

title: 'US benefitted immensely': Musk on H-1B row; praises skilled Indians
content: Elon Musk, speaking on a podcast, acknowledged the benefits of skilled Indian immigrants to the US via the H-1B visa program. However, he also pointed out instances of misuse by some companies seeking to cut costs, advocating for an end to "gaming the system" rather than shutting down the program entirely.

title: Facebook friendship turns deadly: Woman jailed for NRI’s murder; motive linked to property
content: A woman has been sentenced to life imprisonment for poisoning and murdering an NRI man and burying his body. The victim, Raminder Singh Cheema, was lured to a rented house in Jalandhar, drugged, and robbed before being killed. His body was then buried to conceal the crime.

title: Explained: How India's Rupee ended up as Asia's worst currency this year
content: India's currency is facing a sharp decline in 2025. What are the top reasons behind? Is it the trade disputes with the US or the reduced foreign investment or the Reserve Bank of India's managing of the situation with a restrained approach. What is making the rupee's value fall significantly this year?

title: Is Joel Embiid playing vs Hawks? Latest injury update
content: Philadelphia 76ers' star Joel Embiid is questionable for tonight's game against the Atlanta Hawks due to ongoing right knee management.  Having missed nine games, his availability hinges on pain management and on-court participation.  The Sixers, already battling other injuries, face a crucial test of depth as they aim for a win.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
content: Running out of Gmail storage is a common issue, often exacerbated by connected Google services like Drive and Photos.  This article outlines practical steps to clear space, including emptying trash, deleting large attachments, and utilizing the Google One Storage Manager.  Adopting smart habits can prevent future storage problems and maintain optimal performance.

title: 'Shadow fleet': India imported 5.4m tonnes of Russian oil; how Moscow dodged curbs
content: India received 5.4 million tonnes of Russian oil worth 2.1 billion euros via 30 vessels operating under false flags between January and September 2025, a report reveals. This highlights Russia's use of a growing 'shadow fleet' to bypass Western sanctions, with India being a major recipient of these oil shipments.

title: 'My partner is half-Indian': Musk reveals on Nikhil Kamath podcast — 'son’s middle name is Sekhar'
content: Elon Musk revealed his partner, Shivon Zilis, is of Indian descent, with one of their sons' middle names being Sekhar in tribute to physicist Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. Zilis, who grew up in Canada after being adopted, is a key figure at Neuralink. Musk also commented on the changing landscape for Indian talent in America due to visa policies.

title: ‘Tragic death’: Indian-origin student from Haryana fatally stabbed in UK; probe under way
content: An Indian-origin student, identified as Vijay Kumar Sheoran from Haryana, was fatally stabbed in a street attack in Worcester, central England. Police have arrested five men on suspicion of murder, who have since been released on bail pending further investigation. Authorities are appealing for witnesses to the incident.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Klay Thompson names his boat 'SS Stallion' after Megan Thee Stallion; fans react
content: Golden State Warriors star Klay Thompson has renamed his boat 'SS Stallion' in a public tribute to his girlfriend, rapper Megan Thee Stallion. This affectionate gesture, shared on Instagram, highlights their comfortable and confident romance. Fans are embracing the public display of commitment, seeing it as a natural progression for the couple who have been openly dating for months.

title: Kohli to reverse Test retirement? BCCI Secretary breaks silence
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has dismissed rumours of approaching Virat Kohli to reverse his Test retirement, stating no such conversation has occurred. These speculations arose amid India's recent Test struggles. Meanwhile, Kohli's century powered India to a 17-run ODI victory over South Africa, with Kuldeep Yadav and Harshit Rana also impressing with the ball.

title: Musk didn’t want Trump to impose tariffs? Here's what Tesla CEO said
content: Elon Musk discussed US trade policies and the H-1B visa system with Nikhil Kamath, expressing his opposition to aggressive tariffs and advocating for free trade. Musk also boldly predicted that advancements in AI and robotics will make working optional within 10-15 years, leading to a world of near-limitless abundance.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Aaron Rodgers’ status vs Bills: Shock injury twist reveals plan despite fractures
content: Aaron Rodgers is expected to start for the Pittsburgh Steelers in Week 13 despite suffering at least three fractures in his left wrist. The veteran quarterback returned to full practice before the matchup against the Buffalo Bills and carries no injury designation. His ability to play has major implications for Pittsburgh’s AFC North race and the Steelers’ playoff push.

title: Cooper Flagg surpasses LeBron as Mavericks rookie sets rare NBA record
content: Dallas Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg etched his name in NBA history, becoming the youngest player to score 35 points in a game against the Los Angeles Clippers.  Flagg's impressive performance, which included 11 assists, saw him surpass LeBron James' previous record by five days. Coach Jason Kidd lauded Flagg's all-around game and composure.

title: 'Global first': Turkey's drone shoots down aircraft with air-to-air missile - watch
content: Turkey's Bayraktar Kızılelma, an uncrewed fighter jet, has achieved a historic milestone by successfully shooting down a jet-powered aircraft using a beyond-visual-range missile during trials. This marks the first time an unmanned aerial vehicle has demonstrated such air-to-air combat capability, utilizing domestically developed radar and missile technology. The advanced UAV also conducted joint flights with F-16s.

title: Important days in Dec : National and international dates to note for holidays, observances – details
content: Important days in December 2025: December marks a vibrant end to the year in India with national commemorations like Vijay Diwas and Kisan Diwas, alongside widespread Christmas celebrations. Regional festivals and tribal events highlight the nation's rich diversity. Globally, the month emphasizes crucial awareness campaigns on health, human rights, and environmental sustainability, fostering a spirit of collective responsibility.

title: Seth Curry returns to Warriors on 1-year deal, sparking reunion buzz with Steph
content: Seth Curry is rejoining the Golden State Warriors for the remainder of the 2025-26 NBA season, fulfilling the dream of playing alongside his brother Stephen. Initially waived due to financial restrictions, Seth was recently signed to a one-year deal, marking his first time sharing an NBA court with Stephen after 12 seasons and nine previous teams.

title: Stock market holidays in December: Check details for NSE, BSE
content: Indian stock markets will observe a holiday on Thursday, December 25, for Christmas, with trading resuming on Friday, December 26. This marks the only major scheduled market closure in December, making it a relatively quiet month for trading. The last trading session in November concluded flat for both the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty.

title: 'Op Sindoor not over': BSF says terror launchpads active; on alert for infiltration bids
content: Despite Operation Sindoor destroying several terrorist launching pads across the LoC, the BSF reports that some remain active, with Pakistan attempting to infiltrate terrorists ahead of winter. These shifting launchpads, now located in "depth areas" away from the border, are reportedly used for pushing terrorists into India, with groups now mixed.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Toll climbs to 334 in Sri Lanka; India steps up relief ops
content: Sri Lanka is facing a severe crisis as Cyclone Ditwah has caused devastating floods and landslides, resulting in at least 334 deaths and nearly 400 people missing. Over a million individuals are affected, with low-lying areas in Colombo still inundated. India has dispatched an additional 10 tons of disaster response aid, including a medical team, to assist the nation.

title: 'I'm 37 and need time for recovery': What Kohli said after India's win
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 135 powered India to a 17-run victory over South Africa in the first ODI. His 52nd ODI century, a record in a single format, alongside Rohit Sharma's 57, set a strong foundation. Despite a late South African surge, Kuldeep Yadav's crucial wickets secured the win, giving India a 1-0 series lead.

title: Parl winter session's economic agenda: 9 bills listed; sin-goods taxation & more in focus
content: Parliament's Winter Session kicks off with a robust economic agenda, featuring nine key bills. Reforms include a 100% FDI cap for insurance, new taxation for tobacco and pan masala, and a consolidated Securities Markets Code.  The session also aims to decriminalize minor offenses and update corporate laws, promising significant legislative action.

title: 'Death squad': DC shooter linked to Afghanistan's elite 'Zero Unit' - What is it?
content: An Afghan national, formerly with US military and CIA-backed units, was arrested for a daylight shooting in Washington D.C. The incident led the Trump administration to pause asylum decisions and suspend visas for Afghan nationals. The suspect allegedly served in a "Zero Unit" known for high-risk missions.

title: Will Justin Herbert play today? Latest injury update on Chargers star QB
content: Despite an average season with four losses in eleven games, the Los Angeles Chargers' star quarterback Justin Herbert is set to play against the Las Vegas Raiders. Herbert, who recently recovered from an ankle injury, is deemed fully fit by the team. Head coach Jim Harbaugh praised Herbert as one of the best quarterbacks of all time.

title: 'I don't believe in apologies': Gavaskar slams SA coach for 'grovel' remark
content: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar has voiced his disapproval of South Africa coach Shukri Conrad's remark during the recent Test series. Gavaskar pointed out India's significant role in South Africa's cricket return and current investments through the SA20 league. He suggested Conrad acknowledge his comment, emphasising the strong, collaborative bond between Indian and South African cricket over the years.

title: 'Pushed her off train': Navy officer’s wife found dead on rly tracks; TTE booked
content: A woman, Arti Yadav, wife of a Navy officer, died after allegedly being pushed from a train by a TTE in Etawah. She had boarded the wrong train due to a delay. Witnesses claim the TTE threw her luggage and pushed her. Her father alleges murder, while police are investigating, considering the possibility she jumped.

title: 'Ponting also rated him as GOAT': Gavaskar as Kohli surpasses Tendulkar
content: Virat Kohli has etched his name in history, smashing his 52nd ODI century to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record. This monumental achievement, witnessed in Ranchi against South Africa, solidifies Kohli's status as an ODI batting titan.  Even amidst retirement calls, his stellar 135-run knock, alongside contributions from Sharma and Rahul, propelled India to a formidable 350.

title: ‘Unable to cope’: Two BLOs die in UP; one by suicide, another from cardiac arrest
content: Two Booth Level Officers died in Uttar Pradesh amid the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of poll rolls. Sarvesh Singh died by suicide, citing work pressure. Shobharani died of cardiac arrest after working late. The Election Commission has extended the revision schedule by one week. These incidents highlight the strain on BLOs across several states.

title: Breece Hall injury update: Jets RB’s status vs Falcons revealed today
content: Despite a poor season for the New York Jets, star running back Breece Hall is set to play against the Atlanta Falcons. Hall, who has overcome serious past injuries, was reportedly a trade target but is now fully fit and focused on the current season. The Jets are looking for a win at MetLife Stadium.

title: Honduras presidential race: Country sees potential right shift; Trump makes aid threats
content: Honduras voted Sunday with US aid hanging in the balance, as President Trump backed right-wing candidate Nasry Asfura against incumbent leftist Xiomara Castro.  Polls showed a tight race, with Rixi Moncada and Salvador Nasralla also vying for the presidency. Trump's threats to cut aid if Asfura lost, coupled with his pledge to pardon a former Honduran president facing drug charges, added significant international pressure to the election.

title: ‘Immortal love’: Teen marries boyfriend’s corpse; family booked for caste killing
content: A teenage girl in Nanded performed symbolic wedding rituals with her murdered boyfriend's body after her father and brothers were arrested for his killing over their inter-caste relationship. The girl, Aanchal, stated her family opposed their union due to caste differences and vowed to live with her deceased lover's mother.

title: Big govt order: WA, Telegram told to link services to SIM cards; what it means for users
content: India's Union government mandates SIM card verification and six-hour session timeouts for messaging apps to combat cyber fraud. Platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram must ensure continuous SIM linkage, blocking access if the original SIM is absent. This directive aims to enhance telecom cybersecurity by preventing misuse from outside the country.

title: IND vs SA: Fan breaches security and falls at Virat Kohli's feet - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's record-breaking 52nd ODI century powered India to 349/8 against South Africa. The star batsman's 135, supported by Rohit Sharma's 57 and KL Rahul's 60, formed the backbone of the innings. However, the standout moment after the veteran's ton came when a pitch invader briefly interrupted the celebrations but was quickly removed by officials.

title: Indonesia floods: Toll rises to 442, hundreds missing; warships deployed for rescue ops
content: Indonesia's death toll from severe floods and landslides has reached 442, with hundreds missing and injured, as two cities on Sumatra remain unreachable. Thailand is also grappling with devastating floods, having claimed 162 lives, while Malaysia continues to shelter thousands displaced by the monsoon. Climate change is cited as a factor intensifying these deadly weather events.

title: Russell's retirement: SRK quips - 'Any other jersey would look weird on you'
content: Andre Russell has retired from the Indian Premier League. Kolkata Knight Riders co-owner Shah Rukh Khan shared a tribute. Russell will now serve as KKR's power coach. He had a significant career with the team. KKR aims for a better season and has a large purse for the upcoming auction.

title: Hong Kong fire: Anger over 146 deaths spills on to streets; China slaps sedition law
content: Public anger over Hong Kong's deadliest fire has led to protests demanding accountability. Student activist Miles Kwan, who called for an independent investigation, was reportedly detained under the national security law. Authorities accused "anti-China forces" of exploiting the tragedy, while activists argue the inferno was a preventable disaster.

title: ‘Incredible potential’: British Airways eyeing expansion in India, says COO
content: British Airways is significantly boosting its India operations, adding a third daily flight to Delhi next year. Citing "incredible potential" and strong outbound travel demand, the airline sees India as its second-largest market. This expansion includes local hiring and a robust contact center, underscoring a commitment to the growing Indian aviation sector.

title: Earthquake: 4.4-magnitude quake hits Nepal’s Bajhang; no damages reported
content: A 4.4-magnitude earthquake jolted Nepal's Bajhang district in Sudur Paschim province on Sunday afternoon. The tremors, originating from the Saipal mountain region, were also felt in nearby western districts. No immediate reports of damage or casualties have been issued.

title: SIR extension proves that the revision is a hurried process, says Trinamool
content: The EC on Sunday announced the extension of the schedule of the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls in nine States and three Union Territories by one week

title: Young candidates infuse new energy into poll campaign
content: Political parties are fielding young candidates, some as young as 21 or still in college, who are taking on seasoned politicians and bringing much-needed enthusiasm to the local body elections

title: BJP has been ‘splitting parties’ for its entire history: Maharashtra minister
content: He said, the BJP poached one of his family members during the Assembly elections and has since poached a member of MP Rajabhau Waze’s family

title: West Bengal government directs digitisation of waqf properties on UMEED portal
content: ‘Existing Registered Waqf Properties’ are to be uploaded by the respective mutawallis within six months from the date of launch of the UMEED portal, the State government has said

title: Bangladeshi nationals leave India via Hakimpur border checkpost amid rising SIR fears
content: Many say they are returning after watching videos of departure and fearing arrest under ongoing SIR exercise

title: Top leaders add zest to campaigning in Kozhikode Corporation
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan, Congress Working Committee member Ramesh Chennithala, and senior BJP leader V.K. Sajeevan join candidates as campaigning peaks

title: Assam CM ‘stoking conflict’ between communities, says Gaurav Gogoi after report on ST status for six groups
content: After a Group of Ministers’ report proposed a three-tier classification of STs to accommodate the demand of six communities for ST status, the Congress leader says the report has failed to convince that the rights of existing ST communities will remain intact. He accuses Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of doing ‘divide and rule’ politics.

title: IPFT to hold protest in Delhi demanding autonomous Tipra Territorial Council through Constitutional amendment
content: Party leaders say they have not given up the demand for a separate tribal State but primarily sought the setting up of Tipra Territorial Council in line with the Bodo Territorial Council

title: Rajasthan revokes controversial order to mark December 6 as Shaurya Diwas after drawing flak
content: The directive proposed essay competitions on themes such as Indian cultural pride and the Ram Mandir movement

title: Congress discusses Centre’s stance on SIR debate, Vande Mataram anniversary
content: Opposition parties may stall Parliament proceedings till the government agrees to their demand for a debate on the SIR, sources said

title: Centre writes to States to consider renaming Raj Bhavans as Lok Bhavans
content: Letter cites colonial associations in existing names; West Bengal and Ladakh change names after receiving the letter

title: Youth to take out rally in Dharwad today to get vacant posts filled
content: Meanwhile, police refuse to give permission for rally as the organisers have ‘not followed the due process’

title: Cyclone Ditwah weakens; 3 die in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu
content: Light to moderate rain is likely at isolated places over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry-Karaikal on December 1, with thunderstorms and lightning at a few places. Heavy rain is likely at isolated places in Tiruvallur district, according to the Regional Meteorological Centre bulletin.

title: Five killed, several injured as truck rams into vehicles in Bihar
content: “Prima facie, it appears that the truck driver dozed off behind the wheel, leading to the accident,” say police

title: Judgments must not be tossed out after their authors retire: Justice Nagarathna
content: The comment by the lone woman judge in the Supreme Court follows recent overruling of judgments by subsequent Benches

title: Akhilesh flags ‘commercialisation’ of Janeshwar Mishra Park, calls for citizens’ movement against U.P. government
content: Janeshwar Mishra Park, located in Lucknow, is one of the largest urban parks in Asia, covering approximately 376 acres

title: Divide Belagavi district for administrative convenience, says Balachandra Jarkiholi
content: The general public will benefit with the creation of Gokak and Chikkodi districts, according to the BJP MLA

title: Aim is to lift State’s urbanisation rate to national average: Bihar Minister Nitin Nabin
content: The focus is on attracting further investment and creating more employment opportunities for the State’s youth, says the Urban Development and Housing Minister

title: Election Commission tells Supreme Court Centre’s citizenship scrutiny powers are ‘limited’
content: Election Commission tells Supreme Court that the Union government’s role is confined to reviewing foreign citizenship acquisition, defends SIR as a constitutional exercise to maintain accurate electoral rolls

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Officials on alert
content: People asked to immediately dial 112 or inform the district control room at 80999 99977 in case of emergency

title: VPN services suspended in Poonch, Rajouri districts in J&K for two months
content: In an order, Poonch District Magistrate Ashok Kumar Sharma said the police apprised them of an unprecedented high usage of VPNs in the past few days at different locations of the district by suspicious internet users. The two districts, part of the Pir Panjal valley, are close to the Line of Control.

title: Telangana to compete with global nations: Revanth Reddy
content: The Chief Minister said that the government is striving to strengthen the State’s economy and ensure employment for the youth, besides providing quality healthcare and education for all

title: Great Nicobar project site hotbed of new species’ discovery
content: Regular discoveries of new species, including the latest finds, highlights the rich biodiversity of the island, which is reported to have 650 species of plants and over 1,800 species of fauna

title: Govt. issues order for KSCMF to procure and supply maize to distilleries
content: The step comes comes after distillers pointed out at the high cost of ₹2,639 per quintal if they had to purchase maize from NAFED or NCCF

title: VACB nets third bribe accused govt. official in three days; village officer arrested
content: The back-to-back arrests mark 52 trap cases recorded by VACB thus far this year, of which an alarming 70% of the accused are government employees

title: UDF promises to make Kochi south India’s first ‘total smart city’
content: Front’s manifesto outlines projects for the city’s development, including a garbage-free environment, control of mosquito menace, relief from traffic snarls, and steps to address stray dog issue

title: CM wants Ministers, officials to undertake comprehensive review of Vision document
content: Says at a review meeting that Ministers and departmental officials should thoroughly discuss and study every aspect of the Vision document within their respective jurisdictions

title: Mann ki Baat: Tamil is the pride of India, says PM Modi
content: In his ‘Mann Ki Baat’ address, the Prime Minister urges people to participate in the upcoming Kashi Tamil Sangamam, organised on the theme ‘Learn Tamil-Tamil Karkalam’, from December 2. He tells people to visit Himalayan valleys for winter tourism. Modi also recounts various recent events and developments in multiple fields.

title: BJP organises mass screening of ‘Mann Ki Baat’ at 5,000 locations in Andhra Pradesh
content: The programme has become a platform for highlighting the achievements of rural India and inspiring young innovators, says BJP State president Madhav

title: CB-CID approaches Interpol and NFSU to expedite vital reports in Kodanad dacoity-cum-murder case
content: The CB-CID has approached the Interpol for immediate assistance in tracing the origin of multiple calls received by two prime accused. It has requested the NFSU to expedite the cyber forensic analysis of the call detail records of the mobile numbers used by more than 30 people who are on the list of suspects

title: J&K’s new law allows round-the-clock functioning of businesses
content: The government will ensure workers’ dignity, safety, and job security, and transparent business practices in J&K, Deputy CM Surinder Choudhary said

title: Andhra Pradesh stands first in controlling HIV cases, says Health Minister
content: A.P. State AIDS Control Society achieves 76.96% of the 80% target set by the National AIDS Control Organisation, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Urgent need to transform public perception of police: PM Modi
content: PM asks police chiefs to monitor banned outfits, develop areas freed of LWE, strengthen coastal security; calls for holistic approach to disaster management and combating drug abuse

title: Arrest killers of anti-drug activist Penchalayya, demands CPI(M)
content: Calling for decisive steps to dismantle drug mafia network operating across the State, party State secretary Srinivasa Rao questions the alleged political protection the accused reportedly enjoys

title: Punkunnam residents’ bold message to candidates: fix road before seeking votes
content: With a year-old damaged road still ignored, Udayanagar locals put up bold flex boards urging poll contestants to prove their commitment before seeking votes

title: Kerala SIR: deadline extension brings some relief, but more time needed, say political parties
content: CPI(M) leader M.V. Jayarajan describes EC decision as belated wisdom at weekly review meetings on SIR chaired by Chief Electoral Officer

title: Viral video claiming mass copying false and misleading, says Hyderabad’s MS Degree College
content: Claims video is not related, as B.A. Economics III Semester exam for students of Telangana Social Welfare Residential Women’s Degree College, Chaitanyapuri, was held on November 28

title: 11 persons killed, 50 injured as two TNSTC buses collide in Sivaganga
content: A bus proceeding from Karaikudi to Devakottai and another travelling from Devakottai to Dindigul collided near Vivekananda  Polytechnic College.  The driver of one of the buses died on the spot. CM Stalin announces solatium for the families of the deceased

title: Rahul Easwar, Sandeep Varier indicted for ‘defaming’ rape survivor
content: Complainant says vicious attacks and character assassination, including hinting at her identity, caused her severe trauma

title: Farmer associations in Andhra Pradesh oppose Seed Bill-2025
content: They term the legislation proposed by the Centre as pro-corporate, and demand that the State government conduct a comprehensive consultation before making its stand clear

title: Fight for cyclone-hit A.P. farmers in Parliament, Jagan tells YSRCP MPs
content: Ahead of Winter Session, the former CM directs party MPs to highlight the need for emergency relief funds and immediate restoration of assured MSP procurement besides steps to protest VSP

title: Kadthal farmers meet PGCIL officials over losing lands due to Bidar-Maheshwaram line
content: Led by BRS MP V. Ravichandra, ex-MLA G. Jaipal Yadav, they urge Powergrid officials to save their valuable lands with 765 kV transmission line

title: AP JAC Amaravati leaders seek timely settlement of pending dues
content: Among others, they want the government to ensure urgent clearance of bills pertaining to deceased employees and retirees, and medical reimbursements

title: Decomposed body, suspected to be of missing Bengaluru man, found in Kalamassery
content: The remains, believed to be at least one-and-a-half months old, were discovered by the SIT probing the missing case filed by the 58-year-old Bengaluru resident’s son earlier in October

title: NTR Bharosa pensions to be delivered at homes in Eluru on December 1
content: Beneficiaries who are unable to receive pension on December 1 will have their payments disbursed on December 3

title: Digitisation of 75% of SIR forms complete in Ernakulam
content: As per data compiled, Kothamangalam Assembly constituency leads the digitisation process with 77.71%, followed by Kalamassery (77.56%), Kunnathunad (77.54%), and Paravur (76.92%)

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Heavy rainfall across South Coastal A.P., CWC issues red alert for the region
content: State declares holiday for all government, private, aided, and Anganwadi schools, as well as all government, private, and junior colleges on December 1 and PGRS programme is also cancelled; Prakasam, SPSR Nellore, and Tirupati district administrations and local Ministers alert the public

content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: Govt buses collide head-on in Tamil Nadu; 11 killed, over 20 injured
content: Ahamed Ali is a senior reporter working in Madurai, covering crime and forests. He loves writing human interest stories.

title: Clean homes, dirty streets: Two faces of our civic sense
content: behaviours such as littering, spitting, flouting queues, honking needlessly, damaging shared property have become so routine that they often pass without notice . the problem is not just policy, enforcement, or infrastructure, it is about mindsets passed quietly from one generation to the next .

title: ‘Six militants stormed base’: Suicide blast hits paramilitary HQ in Pakistan; three killed
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: 🏈 Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top 12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the résumés are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: AP Week 14 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: Texas A&M lost its spot in the SEC championship game and its undefeated season . the rest of the teams in position to reach the CFP all managed to win . let's break down the rankings .

title: Throwbacks from Pats, Commanders, Seahawks top NFL Week 13 looks
content: the combination includes a plain silver helmet, navy jersey and white pant look . the Baltimore Ravens wore their classic threads against the Cincinnati Bengals . it's a busy week for alternates as part of the league's John Madden Thanksgiving celebration .

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?
content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .

title: Grading coaching hires: Kiffin to LSU, Sumrall to Florida and more
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . schools around the Power 4 that fired their coaches in the first two months of the season are targeting candidates and finalizing deals . the financial component with jobs is essential -- what schools are willing to spend not just on their head coach, but the assistants and support staff .

title: Michigan State fires Jonathan Smith: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: the Spartans had an AP top-10 finish as recently as 2021, when they finished 11-2 and won the Peach Bowl after awarding then-coach Mel Tucker a record contract . a second-year coach like Jonathan Smith was fired Sunday with a final record of 4-15 . the program has quickly lost all national relevancy .

title: Week 14 college football reaction: How to rate bubble teams' CFP chances
content: the last playoff rankings before championship weekend will show us which teams the committee actually trust . a few teams sit in the gray zone where the odds make no sense . the fact that Texas isn't listed on the board is the market saying, "we don't need to price this because the path is effectively dead"

title: Women's College Volleyball Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: the selection show on Sunday at 6 p.m. ET on ESPN . the other 33 at-large teams will be revealed . make your picks Pittsburgh's win over Louisville was convincing enough to push the Panthers onto the top line as the final no. 1 seed .
